alert.note: Alert for Avoyelles; Evangeline; Rapides; St. Landry; Upper St. Martin (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN RAPIDES...EASTERN EVANGELINE...NORTHWESTERN ST. MARTIN...AVOYELLES AND ST. LANDRY PARISHES THROUGH 845 PM CST... At 800 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Acme to Savoy. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to vegetation and outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Opelousas, Ville Platte, Marksville, Bunkie, Simmesport, Krotz Springs, Leonville, Arnaudville, Melville, Moreauville, Palmetto, Bordelonville, Bayou Current, Morrow, Effie, Sunset, Port Barre, Cottonport, Henderson, and Mansura. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 116 and 126. Interstate 49 between mile markers 9 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CST for central, south central and southwestern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Avoyelles; Evangeline; Rapides; St. Landry; Upper St. Martin
